Thanks for the stack trace, it makes clear where the problem comes from. To fully understand what's going on it'd be good to know how your include path and your includes look like (local disk, symbolic links, mapped drives, includes starting with or containing "../", absolute includes?

make -k

This is the build output. It looks like the relative path is getting the scanner confused when attempting to resolve the file

\a\th\aps\fos\works\target\proj\yap-a5312t

this is where I'm making the file and is ocnfigured as the build directory. Otherwise, all include paths are from automatic scanning, I haven't included anything manually. I'm running on Windows XP -- no symbolic links, mapped drives. All paths are absolute.


I believe that you compile a little application with gcc on the fly to process this error file? I could debug that see and give you more details on where it is failing...or something of that order.

Thanks for looking!
